'''Notion''' is a [[freemium]] productivity and [[note-taking]] [[web application]] developed by Notion Labs Inc. It offers organizational tools including [[task management]], [[Project management|project tracking]], [[Time management|to-do lists]], [[Social bookmarking|bookmarking]], and more. Additional offline features are offered by desktop and mobile applications available for [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]], [[macOS]], [[Android (operating system)|Android]], and [[iOS]]. Users can create custom templates, embed videos and web content, and [[Real-time collaborative editing|collaborate with others in real-time]].

==History==
Notion Labs Inc is a [[Startup company|startup]] based in [[San Francisco]], founded in 2013 by Ivan Zhao, Chris Prucha, Jessica Lam, Simon Last and Toby Schachman.<ref>{{Cite web |last= |first= |title=Notion Labs, Inc. Company Profile: Financials, Valuation, and Growth |url=https://system.privco.com/company/notion-labs |access-date=2022-07-21 |website=PrivCo |language=English}}</ref> At that time, they declined to meet any [[Venture capital|venture capitalists]] or discuss acquiring a higher [[Valuation (finance)|valuation]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.businessinsider.com/notion-has-vc-knocking-on-its-doors-to-invest-2019-2|title=This enterprise software startup has VCs literally knocking on its doors to invest, but for now, it's not interested|last=Bastone|first=Nick|website=[[Business Insider]]|access-date=2020-02-05}}</ref>

In March 2018, Notion 2.0 was released. It was positively received by [[Product Hunt]] and rated #1 Product of the Month.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.producthunt.com/posts/notion-2-0|title=Notion 2.0 - The all-in-one workspace - notes, tasks, wikis, & databases|website=Product Hunt|access-date=2020-02-05}}</ref> At that point, the company had fewer than 10 employees.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://usefyi.com/notion-history/|title=How Ivan Zhao's Notion Is Going After Atlassian and Why It Just Might Win|last=Shah|first=Hiten|date=2019-05-28|website=FYI|access-date=2020-02-05}}</ref>

In June 2018, an official [[Android (operating system)|Android]] app was released.<ref>{{cite web |url = https://www.theverge.com/2018/6/7/17434754/notion-android-app-notes-productivity-review |title = Notion brings its powerful note-taking app to Android |date = 7 June 2018 |work = [[The Verge]]}}</ref>

In September 2019, the company announced it had reached 1 million users.<ref name=":3" /> In April 2020, it became valued at two billion dollars.<ref name=":0">{{Cite web|date=2020-08-11|title=레고블록처럼 사용하는 생산성 앱 '노션' 한국어 버전 정식 출시|trans-title=Full release of productivity app 'Notion' in Korean|url=https://www.techm.kr/news/articleView.html?idxno=74234|url-status=live|access-date=2021-05-07|website=테크M|language=ko}}</ref>

In January 2020, Notion received $50 million in investments from [[Index Ventures]] and other investors.<ref name=":3">{{Cite news|last=Griffith|first=Erin|date=2020-04-01|title=Notion, Maker of Collaboration Software, Raises $50 Million|language=en-US|work=The New York Times|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2020/04/01/technology/notion-startup-fund-raising.html|access-date=2021-09-08|issn=0362-4331}}</ref>

On September 7, 2021, Notion acquired Automate.io, a [[Hyderabad]]-based startup.<ref>{{cite web |title=Notion acquires India's Automate.io in push to accelerate product expansion |url=https://techcrunch.com/2021/09/08/notion-acquires-indias-automate-io-in-push-to-accelerate-product-expansion/ |website=Techcrunch |date=8 September 2021 |access-date=1 October 2021}}</ref> In October of that year, a new round of funding led by [[Coatue Management]] and [[Sequoia Capital]] helped Notion raise $275 million. The investment valued Notion at $10 billion, and the company had 20 million users.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Konrad|first=Alex|title=Notion Reaches $10 Billion Valuation, Boosted By Remote Work — And TikTok|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/alexkonrad/2021/10/08/notion-raises-at-10-billion-valuation-boosted-by-remote-work-tiktok/|access-date=2022-01-28|website=Forbes|language=en}}</ref>

In 2022, Notion launched the Notion Certified Program, an official accreditation allowing users to expand their expertise.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Lawrence |first=Lizzy |date=2022-03-02 |title=Notion wants to mobilize your Notion-obsessed employees |url=https://www.protocol.com/workplace/notion-conference-enterprise-productivity-influencer |access-date=2022-03-08 |website=Protocol |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Finnegan |first=Matthew |date=2022-03-04 |title=Coda and Notion turn up the heat on Microsoft Office |url=https://www.computerworld.com/article/3652691/coda-and-notion-turn-up-the-heat-on-microsoft-office.html |access-date=2022-03-08 |website=Computerworld |language=en}}</ref> It also joined the [[Security First Initiative]], a coalition of tech companies pledging to share security information with their customers.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Release |first=Press |date=2022-03-08 |title=Utah-based Whistic leads out in new security-first initiative consortium |url=https://www.utahbusiness.com/utah-based-whistic-leads-out-in-new-security-first-initiative-consortium/ |access-date=2022-03-09 |website=Utah Business |language=en-US}}</ref>

In June 2022, Notion acquired calendar software Cron to add it to its suite of productivity apps.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Notion acquires calendar app Cron |url=https://www.protocol.com/bulletins/notion-acquires-calendar-app-cron |date=2022-06-09 |website=[[Protocol (website)|Protocol]] |last=Lawrence |first=Lizzy |language=en}}</ref>

In November 2022, Notion announced its official Japanese release.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Notion「日本語正式版」になる |url=https://www.watch.impress.co.jp/docs/news/1454615.html |date=2022-11-10 |website=www.watch.impress.co.jp |accessdate=2022-11-10 }}</ref>

In February 2023, Notion officially released the "Notion AI" service that can be used on the workspace.<ref>{{Cite web |title=What Is Notion AI? The Latest Buzzy Writing Assistant, Explained |url=https://screenrant.com/what-is-notion-ai/ |date=2023-02-24 |website=screenrant.com |accessdate=2023-02-26 }}</ref>

In April 2023, Notion officially released an extra layer of account security with a second method of verification, also known as 2FA or MFA. <ref>{{Cite web |title=2-step verification – Notion Help Center |url=https://www.notion.so/help/two-step-verification?utm_campaign=(April)%20What%27s%20New%20-%20Personal&utm_campaigntype=newsletter&utm_content=Preheader%201&utm_medium=email&utm_source=customer.io |access-date=2023-05-02 |website=Notion |language=en-us}}</ref>

== Software ==
'''Notion''' is a [[Collaborative software|collaboration]] platform with modified [[Markdown]] support that integrates [[kanban]] boards, tasks, [[Wiki software|wikis]] and databases. It is an all-in-one workspace for [[Notetaking software|notetaking]], [[Knowledge management software|knowledge]] and [[Spreadsheet|data]] management, and [[Project management software|project and task management]].<ref>{{cite web|date=8 June 2018|title=Notion goes where Evernote dares not: what you need to know|url=https://androidcommunity.com/notion-goes-where-evernote-dares-not-what-you-need-to-know-20180608/|work=Android Community}}</ref> It is a file management tool offering a unified workspace, allowing users to comment on ongoing projects, participate in discussions, and receive feedback.<ref>{{Cite web |last=updated |first=Collin Probst last |date=2022-07-13 |title=5 things you need to know about Notion |url=https://www.techradar.com/features/5-things-you-need-to-know-about-notion |access-date=2022-12-20 |website=TechRadar |language=en}}</ref> It can be accessed by [[Cross-platform software|cross-platform]] apps and by most [[web browser]]s.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Raphael|first=J. R.|date=2021-10-27|title=3 fantastic ways Notion can make you more efficient|url=https://www.computerworld.com/article/3636153/3-fantastic-ways-notion-can-make-you-more-efficient.html|access-date=2022-02-08|website=Computerworld|language=en}}</ref>

It includes a tool for "clipping" content from webpages.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Newton|first=Casey|date=2019-03-06|title=Notion's new web clipper makes it a powerful competitor to Evernote|url=https://www.theverge.com/2019/3/6/18251787/notion-evernote-web-clipper-import-tool|access-date=2022-02-02|website=The Verge|language=en}}</ref> It helps users schedule tasks, manage files, save documents, set reminders, keep agendas, and organize their work. [[LaTeX]] support allows writing and pasting equations in block or inline form.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Lee |first=Joel |date=2019-02-05 |title=The 7 Best Note-Taking Apps for Programmers and Coders |url=https://www.makeuseof.com/tag/best-note-taking-tools-programmers/ |access-date=2022-10-27 |website=MUO |language=en-US}}</ref>

Users can sign in to Notion using their [[Google Account|Google account]], [[Apple ID]] or email.

== Features ==
Notion does not require specialized training to use. It offers AI capabilities and a library of free and fee-based templates, with the Notion AI functionality, users can write and improve content, summarize existing notes, daily standup, adjust the tone, translate or check text.<ref name=":1">{{Cite web |last=Kelly |first=Will |date=2023-01-20 |title=Evernote and Notion take aim at enterprise collaboration market |url=https://www.techtarget.com/searchunifiedcommunications/tip/Evernote-and-Notion-take-aim-at-enterprise-collaboration-market |access-date=2023-02-14 |website=TechTarget |language=en}}</ref> <ref>{{Cite web |last=Snyder |first=Brady |date=2023-02-24 |title=What Is Notion AI? The Latest Buzzy Writing Assistant, Explained |url=https://screenrant.com/what-is-notion-ai/ |access-date=2023-02-24 |website=ScreenRant |language=en}}</ref>Security features include Security Assertion Markup Language single sign-on and private team spaces for their Business and Enterprise tiers.<ref name=":1" />

Notion integrates with SaaS tools including GitHub, GitLab and Zoom, Lucid Software, Cisco Webex and Typeform.<ref name=":1" />

=== Blocks ===
Everything in Notion is made up of blocks. This includes text, images, tables, and even pages themselves. This allows users to easily customize a page by adding and moving blocks in various ways. In June 2021, Notion released a 'synced block', which is a special type of block that, when copied and pasted across different pages in a user's workspace, will shows edits synchronously.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Frank |first=Thomas |date=2021-05-10 |title=Notion Blocks: Everything You Need to Know |url=https://thomasjfrank.com/notion-blocks-guide/ |access-date=2023-05-02 |website=Thomas Frank |language=en-US}}</ref>

=== Databases ===
One of Notion's most notable features is its database. Databases are used for storing information and can hold any number of rows and columns. By default, each row will have two pre-populated properties: 'Name' and 'Tags'. Users can add more properties, such as date, checkbox, multi-select, URL, and more. When creating databases, users can choose to either create it 'inline', within an already existing page, or as its own page.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Los |first=Sija |date=2022-12-09 |title=The Only Tutorial You'll Need to Get Your Notion Up and Running |url=https://medium.com/@Ramblingsofa20something/the-only-tutorial-youll-need-to-get-your-notion-up-and-running-1837657bbc5d |access-date=2023-05-02 |website=Medium |language=en}}</ref>

=== Templates ===
Another popular feature that Notion provides is the ability for users to make templates and share them with others. Notion hosts its very own template gallery, where users can browse through templates made by other Notion creators. However, not all of these templates are free to use. Some creators have also made a profit from selling Notion templates. Jason Ruiyi Chen, a 20-year-old from Singapore, made $239,000 by selling his Notion templates to his Twitter audience. Thomas Frank, a YouTuber with 2.8 million subscribers as of February 2023, earned more than $1 million in 2022. <ref>{{Cite web |title=The YouTuber Making $1 Million Selling Notion 'Templates' |url=https://www.theinformation.com/articles/the-youtuber-making-1-million-selling-notion-templates |access-date=2023-05-02 |website=The Information}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Courter |first=Emily |title=I made $239,000 this year selling budgeting and productivity templates online. It's the perfect business to start as a one-person team. |url=https://www.businessinsider.com/selling-notion-template-twitter-marketing-gum-road-digital-product |access-date=2023-05-02 |website=Business Insider |language=en-US}}</ref>

=== Notion AI ===
Notion AI is based on Artificial Intelligence, which enables prediction of different results, generation and solving mathematical outputs. It will also work with other datasets in response to an input by the user of the AI. This AI can automate complex tasks, write in a better way, also assist the user to make a brief or outline from a single line of an idea. Notion AI has its own subscription set which is '''$10/month/person.'''<ref>{{Cite web |title=Notion AI |url=https://www.notion.so/product/ai |access-date=2023-05-28 |website=Notion |language=en-us}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=Using Notion AI to extend your impact |url=https://www.notion.so/help/guides/using-notion-ai |access-date=2023-05-28 |website=Notion |language=en-us}}</ref>

== Pricing ==
Notion has a four-tiered [[Subscription business model|subscription]] model: Free, Plus, Business and Enterprise.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.notion.so/pricing|title=Notion Pricing Plans}}</ref> Users can also earn credit via [[Referral marketing|referrals]]. As of May 2020, the company upgraded the Personal plan to allow unlimited blocks, a change from the previous cap in the plan.<ref>{{Cite web|last=Newton|first=Casey|date=2020-05-19|title=Notion just removed the biggest limit on its free plan|url=https://www.theverge.com/2020/5/19/21261811/note-taking-app-notion-free-plan-personal-use-unlimited-blocks|access-date=2021-11-07|website=The Verge|language=en}}</ref>
